Author: jukKas#1196
Content: Question about the KMD rewards. If I have rewards accrued and send small transaction to some other address, what will happen to those rewards?

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: the rewards will go back to your wallet if that utxo you spent accrued rewards

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: if you use a fullnode most likely to a new address in your wallet

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: if you use a mobile wallet or agama it goes back to your address

Author: jukKas#1196
Content: So they'll be as a reward waiting to be claimed or will be actually paid to the correct address?

Author: Arno#3334
Content: @CHMEX Just an addition: This automatic claiming when sending only works with wallets that support it (atomicDEX, Agama etc.). Making a transaction with the Ledger Nano S through the Ledger Live App doesn't collect the rewards at all, and they get lost.

Author: Arno#3334
Content: If in doubt: have a look at the actual fee in the transaction. If it's negative, the claiming worked, if it's positive, it didn't work.

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: if you have a ledger you can claim rewards with atomiclabs.github.io/ledger-kmd-reward-claim/

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Yes. I only wanted to point out the difference in regards to normal transactions between the wallets and the danger of losing the rewards.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
> [2:31 AM] jukKas: So they'll be as a reward waiting to be claimed or will be actually paid to the correct address?
when you do any transaction from a wallet that supportt rewards, it will collect them to an address you own as soon as part of the transaction

Author: KOSIUS#0001
Content: There's literally no way to claim the 5% kmd reward with ledger nano s

Author: KOSIUS#0001
Content: you just get an error "ledger device is unavailable" because there's so many public keys to export and I guess it just times out

Author: KOSIUS#0001
Content: after this new ledger update

Author: KOSIUS#0001
Content: please tag me when answering with the solution

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: #dev-rewards

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Is the channel to be I think

Author: Arno#3334
Content: @KOSIUS You could send your entire funds to the next empty address so that all the unspent funds of many addresses are collected onto one single new address. Then probably only one transaction has to be confirmed on the ledger nano s when you claim them. After collecting all funds onto one new address, you can also connect the ledger nano s to the magnumwallet and send, receive and claim your KMD / rewards from there as well.
